data.title: Ensure workspace is read from WorkspaceContextService
data.body:
In most of the codebase (examples linked below), the services, parts, etc which depend on workspace context declare that through the dependency injection system, and always read workspace from the WorkspaceContextService (versus some cached instance state). This change replaces hard wires with getter method calls on the injected WorkspaceContextService, and prefers always using these method calls to read workspace. The primary motivation for the change is consistency.

Examples from past commits of the appropriate pattern:
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/6c45ea534a5297b5c789a957d312dfbfbf19c91c#diff-3e8b9e83c7e6ca3ca4093f266f8b587eR32
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/06538335c010afd03ad29c5c6c0dbb862dc537bc#diff-c93a0e42070e15efe5973a7aa2f71f53R382

data.title: "window.openFilesInNewWindow": false||true  = true. This setting is not valid.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 (1.8.0)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Set this operation `"window.openFilesInNewWindow": false,` or  `"window.openFilesInNewWindow": true,`  Is invalid.
2. I think that opening a single file independently opens a new window.
    Open multiple files at the same time only open a window.
    Allows multiple folders (items) to exist in the same window or tab for easy switching and easy editing.
3. Thanks for providing such excellent vscode.

data.title: File search - navigate history with arrow keys, and fields with tabs?
data.body:
Sublime gives us the ability to cycle through the previous search queries using the arrow keys, the same way as when using a terminal.

Would be cool to have this features also in VSC.

data.title: [Default settings search] Pasting the search term leaves the settings category collapsed
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to File->Preferences->User settings (settings.json)
2. Paste terminal.external from the clipboard

Expected: 3 results found and displayed under External terminal category
Actual: 3 results found, External terminal category displayed as expanded but no settings displayed. You need to double click on the collapse marker to see the results.

![defaultsettingspaste](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4397796/21295420/1ed8228e-c555-11e6-8d3a-b725798adaca.gif)

data.title: delete call in API does not call autoClosingPairDelete
data.body:
I am trying to invoke the autoClosingPairDelete function from the api

In the source code I see:
```
public static deleteLeft(config: CursorConfiguration, model: ICursorSimpleModel, cursor: SingleCursorState): EditOperationResult {
let r = this.autoClosingPairDelete(config, model, cursor);
```

So then I call vscode.window.activeTextEditor.edit with an edit.delete for one char to the left. It does not seem that this snippet of code is executed.

Is there an API call to be able to use the autoClosingPairDelete functionality?

data.title: session of --extensionTestsPath should not be remembered
data.body:
VSCode: 1.9.0-insider
OS: win8.1

Steps:
1. run "Launch Extension" to run your extension
2. open some folder
3. close vscode
4. run "Launch Tests"; i.e. run vscode with `--extensionTestsPath`
5. let the test session run and close automatically
6. run "Launch Extension" again

Observed:
* vscode loads the session from "Launch Tests". I.e. with whatever files and folders were left open from the last test.

Expected:
* vscode loads the session from when "Launch Extensions" ran in steps 1-3

data.title: tsserver verbose tracing is not showing data
C# IntelliSense Hints are unreadable (new lines are missing)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:45:32.595Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|mono-debug|ms-vscode|0.12.0|
|unity-debug|Unity|1.1.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any C# project containing sln and csproj file so full IntelliSense will be working.
2. Hover your mouse over any function containing C# XML Comments with summary, more than one parameter, and return tags.

Below example code and the IntelliSense hint containing parsed XML documentation. If it contains more than one tag (ex. few function parameters + returns) all are **displayed in one line therefore it is unreadable**. It seems that new lines are missing between `<param>` and `<returns>` tags.

![code](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8941375/21294525/eef2a1cc-c53e-11e6-8e81-7f11b6bf5c7b.png)
![hint](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8941375/21294605/eef7288a-c540-11e6-8f4a-150e822195a6.png)

data.title: Make markdown links without protocol (iE /README.md) map to file system
data.body:
Yes, in markdown i can set file links using the `file://path/to/my/file.md` syntax to create file links. However, this depends on where i cloned the repo on my computer.

When I write documentation in markdown, I can link between documents in the following way

```
linked from /doc/documentation.md
* [back](../README.md) 
* [back absolute](/README.md)
```
As expected, a relative link is relative to the current file, an absolute link is resolved to the project root

Here are working examples on [github](https://github.com/fbehrens/doc-example/blob/master/doc/documentation.md) and [gitlab](https://gitlab.com/fbehrens/doc-example/blob/master/doc/documentation.md)

It would be very useful, if those links would also work in VSCODE, because this would make it possible to set and follow the links while writing the documentation in the editor.

There is a related closed issue #11518

data.title: New Window Behaviour broke
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 (1.8.0)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2

For me, the last months when working VSCode,
spawning a new window with Shift + CMD + n has openened a new window as a 'tab' above the editor,
but in the same instance.

I found this incredibly useful for working with multiple projects in the same VSCode window.

However, this was removed in 1.8, now a new window is openened.
Was this removed, or can i somehow enable this behaviour again?
I've read through the docs & the settings but couldn't find anything related.

thanks in advance

1. i used vscode to dev angular2 app,below is my tsconfig
```
{

    "module": "commonjs",

    ]

}
```

data.title: Installing shell command 'code' in PATH does not persist
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.7.2 (1.7.2)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.1 (16B2657)

Secondary problem: If you create a permanent symbolic link or addition to `~/.bash_profile` referring to `code`, VS Code complains about it. So you're stuffed either way. 

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Ran the `Shell Command: Install 'code' command in PATH`.
2. Open new terminal window, `code` will launch VS Code.
3. Restart machine OR even just close VS Code and then restart terminal.app...
4. Fail

I doubt it's the configuration of my`~/.bash_profile`  as any and all other PATH additions are working correctly... I include it below for reference, as you can see it is very minimal:

```export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/go/bin
export GOPATH=$HOME/go
export GOSRC=$GOPATH/src
export PATH=$PATH:$GOPATH/bin
export GOBR=$GOPATH/src/github.com/benjamin-rood

#code () { VSCODE_CWD="$PWD" open -n -b "com.microsoft.VSCode" --args $* ;}
```


The commented-out code script works, btw.

data.title: keybindings colision with non US keyboard layout
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T18:03:00.506Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-30-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.3|

---

Using a PT-PT layout KB, even tough the mapping of keys looks correct (For example on the vscode desktop Toggle Terminal presents `CTRL+\` as the shortcut, which is the equivalent of the US layout ``CTRL+` ``), when pressing it, instead the Split Editor is activated.

The Split Editor is actually configured to use the `CTRL+\` shortcut on the US layout, but on the PT layout the equivalent is `CTRL+~`, which *also* causes the same action.

So it seems that while the equivalent key on the current layout is considered, the original key is still mapped, which causes a mapping collision after, in this case Split Editor is declared first, which binds to `CTRL+\` and `CTRL+~` simultaneously, and Toggle Terminal then can't use `CTRL+\`.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use a Portuguese-Portugal keyboard layout. (reported in Ubuntu as layout: 'pt,us',)
2. With the default keybindings configuration, both `CTRL+\` and `CTRL+~` activate workbench.action.splitEditor, and neither activates workbench.action.terminal.toggleTerminal.
3. Add the overlay: { "key": "ctrl+\\",                "command": "workbench.action.terminal.toggleTerminal" },
4. Now both `CTRL+\` and `CTRL+~` activate workbench.action.terminal.toggleTerminal and neither activate activate workbench.action.splitEditor.

data.title: Sometimes cursor drawn does not match the cursorStyle that is set

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
After the 1.8.0 release, the VSCodeVim extension is not always rendering the correct cursor.

I am using: console.log(vscode.window.activeTextEditor.options.cursorStyle); to verify cursor style

In some cases, it prints vscode.TextEditorCursorStyle.Block (which is what I want), but what is rendered looks to be vscode.TextEditorCursorStyle.Line.

So there is a mismatch between vscode.window.activeTextEditor.options.cursorStyle, I set it to exactly what I want, I query the value of vscode.window.activeTextEditor.options.cursorStyle and it is what I set it to, however what is drawn is NOT what I set it to.

It is easiest to reproduce in settings.json currently, however we are seeing it sporadically in other files as well..

ctrl+shift+p
sett...
Enter

Now in 1.8, if you type 'sett', or even full 'settings', the top result is 'Focus Default Settings Search', which then throws an error about being in the wrong context.

data.title: Markdown preview rendering width does not consider window.zoomLevel correctly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Linux Mint LMDE2 Cinnamon 64-bit, Cinnamon 3.2

Depending on the value of window.zoomLevel or  on the fly with Ctrl-'+' or Ctrl-'-', the Markdown preview width might not fit within its display area:
- for `"window.zoomLevel": 1`, the lines are visibly shorter than the editor area, and the scroll bar sits left of the right border.
![zoomlevel-up](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5325416/21288703/4075c584-c48a-11e6-8a5e-acbe06a327fe.png)
- for `"window.zoomLevel": 0`, the lines just fill the editor area.
- for `"window.zoomLevel": -1`, the lines are overflowing the editor area, no scroll bar is visible, no horizontal scroll bar is displayed.![zoomlevel-down](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5325416/21288709/585b0060-c48a-11e6-9ffd-b6cb33b3bebc.png)

If `window.zoomLevel` is changed in settings.json during runtime, the scrollbar disapears.

Changing fonts or font sizes does change the effective line breaks, but they still try to fit into the same faulty width.
